evidence: Cross-correlation is deeply connected to the Cauchy-Schwarz inequality.
the inner product of two signals is always less than or equal to the product of their norms.
Equality holds only when the two signals are proportional.
the output is maximized when the signal and the template are aligned in shape - a key idea in pattern recognition and signal detection.

concepts.term: This is why cross-correlation works in this way: the output is maximized when the signal and the template are aligned in shape - a key idea in pattern recognition and signal detection.
